meanings.definition: A person who behaves obsequiously to someone important.
meanings.sent1: The toadies surrounded the boss, always agreeing with everything he said.
meanings.sent2: The toadies in the office were always trying to impress the manager.
meanings.sent3: The toadies at the party were like shadows, following the celebrity around.
meanings.sent4: The toadies in the court were compared to loyal dogs, always by the king's side.
meanings.sent5: The image of the toadies bowing and scraping to the queen was hard to forget.

meanings.sent1: He toadies to his boss in hopes of getting a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She toadies to the teacher by always offering to help with tasks.
meanings.sent3: The cat toadies to its owner by purring and rubbing against their legs.
meanings.sent4: The politician toadies to the voters during the campaign, promising everything.
meanings.sent5: The employee toadies to the supervisor by constantly praising their decisions.
